com.jpmorrsn.fbp.core.engine

Class ConnArray

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jpmorrsn.fbp.core.engine.ConnArray
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InputPort

    public class ConnArray
extends java.lang.Object
implements InputPort
    This class is an internal control block used while processing a component's annotations; it is also used for checking 'connect' invocations in network definitions

      • receive

        public Packet receive()
        Description copied from interface: InputPort
        Receive the next available packet from this InputPort. The thread is suspended if no packets are currently available. At the end of input (when all upstream threads have closed their connected OutputPorts), null is returned.
        Specified by:
        receive in interface InputPort
        Returns:
        next packet, null if none

      • setReceiver

      • setType

        public void setType(java.lang.Class tp)
        Description copied from interface: InputPort
        Specify the type of packet content that will be accepted from this InputPort. Specifying null is equivalent to specifying Object.class -- in other words, any packet content is acceptable.
        Specified by:
        setType in interface InputPort
        Parameters:
        tp - the class of acceptable packet content
